title: Self-Explanation-Based Instructional Design for Improving Critical Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic logic and social science principles
context.additional_context: Learners possess diverse social science backgrounds and can interact actively in online environments. While individual learning progress may vary, basic cognitive abilities are met.

learning_goals: Learners can identify logical fallacies in given cases with 80% accuracy
Learners can structure unbiased reasoning processes in three or more stages through self-explanation
Learners can apply critical thinking skills to untrained, novel task types with 60% or higher proficiency
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
